00001 /*
00002 ###############################################################################
00003 #
00004 #  EGSnrc egs++ dose scoring object headers
00005 #  Copyright (C) 2015 National Research Council Canada
00006 #
00007 #  This file is part of EGSnrc.
00008 #
00009 #  EGSnrc is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it under
00010 #  the terms of the GNU Affero General Public License as published by the
00011 #  Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or (at your
00012 #  option) any later version.
00013 #
00014 #  EGSnrc is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY
00015 #  WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS
00016 #  FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the GNU Affero General Public License for
00017 #  more details.
00018 #
00019 #  You should have received a copy of the GNU Affero General Public License
00020 #  along with EGSnrc. If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.
00021 #
00022 ###############################################################################
00023 #
00024 #  Author:          Ernesto Mainegra-Hing, 2012
00025 #
00026 #  Contributors:
00027 #
00028 ###############################################################################
00029 #
00030 #  A general dose calculation tool. Since it is outside the scope of the
00031 #  EGS_Application class, a few utility methods are needed in EGS_Application
00032 #  to retrieve information regarding media, geometry and source.
00033 #
00034 #  Dose is output for each dose region without any spacial information. For a
00035 #  more detailed dose scoring grid it is better to create a user code which
00036 #  could produce 3D dose distributions and graph data.
00037 #
00038 #  Can be used in any C++ user code by entering the proper input block in
00039 #  the ausgab object definition block.
00040 #
00041 #  Prints out dose in each dose scoring region.
00042 #
00043 #  Dose scoring regions can be defined by input using one the following
00044 #  syntax for individual regions:
00045 #
00046 #  :start ausgab object definition:
00047 #      :start ausgab object:
00048 #          library      = egs_dose_scoring
00049 #          name         = some_name
00050 #          volume       = V0  V1 ... Vn
00051 #          dose regions = IR0 IR1 ... IRn
00052 #      :stop ausgab object:
00053 #  :stop ausgab object definition:
00054 #
00055 #  or by groups of consecutive regions:
00056 #
00057 #  :start ausgab object definition:
00058 #      :start ausgab object:
00059 #          library           = egs_dose_scoring
00060 #          name              = some_name
00061 #          volume            = V0 V1 ... Vn
00062 #          dose start region = IRI_0 ... IRI_N
00063 #          dose stop region  = IRE_0 ... IRE_N
00064 #      :stop ausgab object:
00065 #  :stop ausgab object definition:
00066 #
00067 #  where one can have same number of volume entries as group of regions (n=N)
00068 #  or same number of volume entries as number of individual regions. If there
00069 #  are more dose scoring regions than volume entries, a default volume is use for
00070 #  those regions without volume information. This default can be either the first
00071 #  volume entry or 1 g/cm3.
00072 #
00073 #  TODO:
00074 #
00075 #  - Classify dose as contributed by primary or scattered particles
00076 #  - Custom classification using latch
00077 #  - Dose to medium calculation
00078 #
00079 ###############################################################################
00080 */
00081 
00082

00166 class EGS_DOSE_SCORING_EXPORT EGS_DoseScoring : public EGS_AusgabObject {
00167 
00168 public:
00169 
00170     EGS_DoseScoring(const string &Name="", EGS_ObjectFactory *f = 0);
00171 
00172     ~EGS_DoseScoring();
00173 
00174     int processEvent(EGS_Application::AusgabCall iarg) {
00175 
00176         int ir = app->top_p.ir, imed = ir>=0 ? app->getMedium(ir):-1;
00177         EGS_Float edep = app->getEdep();
00178 
00179         /**** energy deposition in a medium ***/
00180         if( iarg <= 4 && imed >= 0 && edep > 0 && doseM) {
00181           doseM->score(imed, edep*app->top_p.wt);
00182         }
00183 
00184         /*** Check if scoring in current region ***/
00185         if (dose){
00186            if (d_reg_index[ir]<0) return 0;
00187         }
00188 
00189         /**** energy deposition in current region ***/
00190         if( iarg <= 4 && ir >= 0 && edep > 0 && dose) {
00191           dose->score(d_reg_index[ir], edep*app->top_p.wt);
00192         }
00193         return 0;
00194     };
00195 
00196     bool needsCall(EGS_Application::AusgabCall iarg) const {
00197          if( iarg <= 4 ) return true;
00198          else            return false;
00199     };
00200 
00201     void setApplication(EGS_Application *App);
00202 
00203     void reportResults();
00204 
00205     void setCurrentCase(EGS_I64 ncase) {
00206         if( ncase != m_lastCase ) {
00207             m_lastCase = ncase;
00208             if (dose)  dose->setHistory(ncase);
00209             if (doseM) doseM->setHistory(ncase);
00210         }
00211     };
00212     int getDigits(int i){
00213         int imax = 10;
00214         while(i>=imax){imax*=10;}
00215         return (int)log10((float)imax);
00216     };
00217 
00218     void setVol(const vector<EGS_Float> volin){vol_list=volin;};
00219     void setVol(const EGS_Float volin){vol_list.push_back(volin);};
00220     void setDoseRegions(const vector <int> d_reg){d_region=d_reg;};
00221     void setMediumScoring(bool flag){score_medium_dose=flag;};
00222     void setRegionScoring(bool flag){score_region_dose=flag;};
00223     void setUserNorm(const EGS_Float & normi){norm_u=normi;};
00224 
00225     bool storeState(ostream &data) const;
00226     bool setState(istream &data);
00227     void resetCounter();
00228     bool addState(istream &data);
00229     int addTheStates(istream &data);
00230 
00231 protected:
00232 
00233   EGS_ScoringArray *dose;  
00234   EGS_ScoringArray *doseM;  
00235   vector <EGS_Float>  vol_list; // Input list of region volumes
00236   vector <int> d_region;        // Input list of dose scoring regions  d_reg[i] = ir
00237   vector <int> d_reg_index;     // list index for dose scoring regions d_reg_index[ir]= 0..d_reg.size()-1
00238   vector <EGS_Float>  vol;      // geometrical region volumes
00239   EGS_Float norm_u;
00240   int nreg,     // number of regions in the geometry
00241       nmedia;   // number of media in the input file
00242   int max_dreg, // maximum dose region number
00243       max_medl; // maximum medium name length
00244   EGS_I64    m_lastCase;   
00245   bool score_medium_dose,
00246        score_region_dose;
00247 };
